title: Fix onboarding tour page scroll functionality after clicking Get Started

requirements.summary: Fix the scroll functionality on the onboarding tour page that occurs after clicking the 'Get Started' button on the landing page
acceptanceCriteria: After clicking 'Get Started' on the landing page, the onboarding tour page loads without any scroll-blocking behavior
All content on the WelcomeScreen is vertically scrollable when it exceeds the viewport height
The page body or container does not have overflow:hidden or fixed positioning preventing scroll
The OnboardingFlow overlay component allows proper scrolling of its content
Users can scroll down to view all onboarding content including all four feature cards and the Skip Tour button
The scroll behavior works correctly on both desktop and mobile viewports

file_operations.description: Review and fix the wrapper container CSS to ensure it allows vertical scrolling. Remove any fixed positioning, overflow:hidden, or height constraints that prevent scrolling. Ensure the overlay wrapper uses appropriate overflow properties (overflow-auto or overflow-y-auto) and proper height settings (min-h-screen instead of h-screen with overflow-hidden) to enable content scrolling when it exceeds viewport height.

Review and fix the container CSS to ensure proper height and overflow settings that enable vertical scrolling. Remove any fixed positioning or overflow:hidden styles that block scrolling. Ensure the content wrapper allows natural content flow and scrolling when content exceeds the viewport.

requirements.summary: Inspect the OnboardingFlow and WelcomeScreen components for CSS styles preventing scrolling
acceptanceCriteria: OnboardingFlow wrapper allows scrolling and does not apply fixed positioning that breaks scroll
WelcomeScreen container has proper height and overflow settings to enable vertical scrolling
Body scroll lock (if implemented) is removed or properly configured to allow scrolling within the onboarding modal
All CSS position, overflow, and height properties are reviewed and corrected

file_operations.description: Audit all CSS classes and inline styles for position:fixed, overflow:hidden, h-screen combined with overflow issues, or z-index problems. Replace problematic styles with scrollable alternatives: use overflow-y-auto for scrollable containers, min-h-screen for full-height layouts that can expand, and relative/absolute positioning only where necessary. Ensure the overlay doesn't lock body scroll unless the modal content itself is scrollable.

Audit all CSS classes and inline styles for position:fixed, overflow:hidden, max-h or h constraints that prevent natural content expansion, or display:flex without proper overflow handling. Ensure the feature grid and all child elements use natural layout flow that allows vertical scrolling when content exceeds viewport height. Remove any height constraints that clip content.

requirements.summary: Verify that the App.tsx component and router configuration do not inadvertently block scrolling when the onboarding flow is active
acceptanceCriteria: The onboarding flow overlay or modal has scrollable content area if it uses fixed/absolute positioning
Document body scrolling is preserved or intentionally managed with overflow-auto on modal content containers
Navigation between onboarding steps maintains scroll functionality
The scroll issue does not recur when progressing through onboarding screens

file_operations.description: Review the OnboardingFlow rendering logic and ensure it doesn't apply body scroll locks or overflow:hidden to document.body when the onboarding overlay is displayed. If the onboarding uses a modal overlay pattern with fixed/absolute positioning, ensure the modal content container has overflow-y-auto and proper height constraints. Verify that showing/hiding the onboarding flow doesn't leave the body in a scroll-locked state.

Ensure that navigation between onboarding steps (next/previous/skip) preserves scroll functionality and resets scroll position appropriately. Verify that step transitions don't introduce temporary scroll locks or position changes that break scrolling. Test that all four onboarding screens (Welcome, NDIS Basics, Feature Demo, Completion) maintain consistent scroll behavior.
